items.title: How Day 1 of the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire unfolded | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Israel has freed 90 Palestinian prisoners as part of its ceasefire deal with Hamas. Early on Monday morning, several buses carrying the detainees left the gates of Israel's Ofer prison, just outside the West Bank city of Ramallah. Hundreds of people gathered to celebrate the release. The freed prisoners are said to be women and teenage boys from the West Bank and Jerusalem. They are the first of 1900 Palestinians Israel is set to release in exchange for 33 Israeli hostages in phase one of the deal.
Earlier, the first Israeli hostages were freed by Hamas militants as part of the deal.  Three women held captive for 471 days were finally brought back home to Israel - alive.  For other families, the wait continues. The six-week pause in fighting, which began on Sunday, will also allow hundreds of truckloads of aid per day to be brought in to the devastated territory. With reporting from DW's Tania Krämer, and analysis from Middle East Analyst Giorgio Cafiero.

#ceasefireingaza #israelhamaswar #gaza 

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Can this ceasefire agreement be a first step toward lasting peace? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>The first three Israeli hostages to be released by Hamas under the new Gaza ceasefire agreement have returned to Israel.
Emily Damari, Doron Steinbrecher and Romi Gonen were delivered to Israeli army officials by the International Red Cross after being handed over by Hamas in Gaza. The women have also been reunited with their closest family members. They're the first of 33 Israeli hostages set to be released during a six-week ceasefire now in effect in Gaza. Meanwhile, since the fighting paused early on Sunday, thousands of Gazans have been returning to what's left of their homes. Aid trucks have also been arriving in Gaza with desperately needed supplies, but the situation is dire. We spoke to Laura Blumenfeld, Middle East Analyst at the Johns Hopkins University in Washington D.C., and the Senior Coordinator for UNICEF, Hamish Young.

#israelhamaswar #ceasefireingaza #hamas

items.title: What's known about the first 90 Palestinian prisoners to be released? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Ninety Palestinian prisoners are due to be released in exchange for the three Israeli hostages handed over by Hamas. In the Israeli-occupied West Bank, families are waiting in the cold for the release of their loved ones from Israeli detention. Since fighting paused this morning, thousands of Gaza Palestinians have been reuniting with loved ones and returning to what's left of their homes.

items.title: Israeli army confirms handover of hostages | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Three Israeli hostages were released by Hamas. The women were picked up in Gaza by Red Cross officials and are now back in Israel. Emily Damari, Doron Steinbrecher and Romi Gonen will be reunited with their families and receive medical checks. The women are the first of 33 Israeli hostages to be released during a six-week ceasefire now in effect in Gaza.

items.title: How much do people trust this ceasefire? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Meanwhile, thousands of Palestinians in Gaza are returning to what's left of their homes. Many families are looking to reunite with loved ones after being separated during more than 15 months of fighting. The United Nations says aid trucks have begun entering Gaza to provide support. The six-week ceasefire deal will also see around 1900 Palestinian prisoners freed in exchange for 90 Israeli hostages.

items.title: Trump's hints at 90-day reprieve for TikTok: What does it mean? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>TikTok has stopped working for users in the United States. The social-media platform was scheduled to shut down for Americans from Sunday, after the US Supreme Court upheld a law banning it as a risk to national security. US President-elect Donald Trump has said he's likely to give TikTok a 90-day reprieve after he takes office on Monday.

items.title: Fragile ceasefire begins in Gaza after deadly 3-hour delay | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>A ceasefire between Israel and Hamas has begun in Gaza after a nearly three-hour delay. The truce didn't begin on schedule after Hamas failed to release the names of the three female hostages to be freed today on time. The Israeli government says that the first hostages are due to be released this afternoon. In return, 90 Palestinian prisoners will be freed at the same time. Aid agencies are set to use the six-week ceasefire to rush more support into the strip.

00:00 Gaza ceasefure begins
00:33 Balig Sladeen reports from Tel Aviv
06:07- DW speaks with Air Vice Marshal Sean Bell, a former pilot in the UK’s Royal Air Force and now an adviser at Universal Defence and Security Solutions in London

items.title: This is what Gaza looks like after 15 months of war | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>After 15 months of war, some 90% of Gazans have been displaced and 46,000 have been killed. Thousands are still buried under the rubble. The UN estimates it could take up to 15 years to clear Gaza of around 40 million tons of rubble.

items.title: Europe's biggest clinic for injured wildlife is in Spain | Focus on Europe
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>At Europe’s largest wildlife clinic, vets and carers treat injured birds, reptiles and mammals. The animals are often brought here by hikers or forest workers. More than 6,500 of them were treated at the center in one year.
